block.p: An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
MUSIC

ACCESS TO ART Summer Chamber Music Festival. Aurelia Mike Chang, pianist, and Kathryn Krueger, violinist. Saturday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $15; $12 for students and older people. Old Court House, Route 9, Cape May. (609) 368-8100.

An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
MUSIC

ACCESS TO ART Summer Chamber Music Festival. Aurelia Mike Chang, pianist, and Kathryn Krueger, violinist. Saturday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $15; $12 for students and older people. Old Court House, Route 9, Cape May. (609) 368-8100.

BAIRD CENTER Outdoor Concert Series with ''Slide Hampton and his Super Jazz Band.'' Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Meadowland Park, North Ridgewood Road, South Orange. Free. 5 Mead Street, South Orange. (973) 378-7754.
CHALFONTE HOTEL ''Concerts by Candlelight'' with Elin Frazier performing ''Music From Heart.'' Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $7. 301 Howard Street, Cape May, in the Henry Sawyer Room. (609) 884-8409.
CONCERTS IN THE PARK Gene Mendalski and the ''G'' Men. Tuesday at 7:15 p.m. Free. George N. Milkosky Park, Linden.

THE CORNERSTONE Jill McCarran Trio. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Harry Allen Quartet. ''Nostalgic Piano Sing Along,'' with Jim Lacano. Thursday at 7 p.m. Friday at 9 p.m. Doug Finke Quartet. Saturday at 9 p.m. 25 New Street, Metuchen. (732) 549-5306.
CRESCENT SCHOOL The Waldwick Band presents an outdoor concert. Tuesday at 8:30 p.m. The Crescent School, Crescent Avenue, Waldwick. (201) 664-2939.
FAIR LAWN SUMMER MUSIC FESTIVAL Mike Capobianco leads an 18-piece band. Tonight at 8:30 p.m. Free. Memorial Park, Berdan Avenue, Fair Lawn. (201) 796-6746.
FREE PUBLIC LIBRARY OF ELIZABETH The Andy Middleton Quartet. Saturday at 2:15 p.m. Free. 11 South Broad Street, Elizabeth. (908) 354-6060.

JOHN HARMS CENTER FOR THE ARTS The Rippingtons, contemporary jazz. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $30 and $35. Patty Larkin, Lucy Kaplansky and John Gorka, acoustic music. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $16 to $30. 30 North Van Brunt Street, Englewood. (201) 567-3600.
KASSCHAU MEMORIAL SHELL Music of the 50's and 60's with Squeaky Clean. Tuesday at 8:30 p.m. Free. Veterans Field, Maple Avenue, Ridgewood. (201) 444-1776.
MAHWAH PUBLIC LIBRARY Summer Music Festival continues with Martin Stadtfeld, pianist. Wednesday at 7 p.m. Free. 100 Ridge Road, Mahwah. (201) 529-7323.

NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER Natalie Merchant. Tonight at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $32 to $56. Prudential Hall.''Absolut Sounds of the City 2000,'' outdoor music series. Thursday evenings, 5 p.m. to 10 p.m., through Aug. 31. Next Thursday; Comphania das Musicas, the Salt Brothers, Treva Offut and Jose de Carmen y Su Bachata Romantica. Mary J. Blige, Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $35 to $65. Theater Square. 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.
NEWARK'S NEIGHBORHOOD SUMMER CONCERT SERIES Joe Thomas and David Robinson. Thursday at 5 p.m. Free. Lincoln Park, Broad Street and Clinton Avenue. (973) 733-6454.

NORTH WILDWOOD SUMMER SERIES Al Alberts Showcase Revue, Thursday at 8 p.m. the Sgro Brothers, harmonica virtuosos, Saturday at 8 p.m. North Wildwood's amphitheater, Ocean and Second Avenues. Free. (609) 889-2241.

OCEAN GROVE SUMMER CONCERT SERIES Through Sept. 9. Organist Mark Laubach, Wednesday at 7:30 p.m and Saturday at noon. Free. ''Four's Salute the Fifties,'' with the Four Lads, the Four Aces and the Four Freshmen. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $17 and $22. The Great Auditorium, Ocean Grove. (732) 988-0645.

PNC BANK ARTS CENTER ''NJ 101.5 Birthday Bash'' with the Beach Boys and the Four Tops. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $49.50. The Red Hot Chili Peppers with Foo Fighters and Blonde Red Head, Friday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $30.50 and $40.50. Chicago with the Little River Band, Saturday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $23.50 to $49.50. Exit 116, off the Garden State Parkway, Holmdel. (201) 507-8900.

PRINCETON UNIVERSITY RICHARDSON AUDITORIUM ''The Osiris Trio,'' works of Haydn and Dvorak. Tuesday at 8 p.m. Free. New Jersey Symphony Orchestra Amadeus Festival, an all-Mozart program. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15, $25, $40. Alexander Hall, Princeton. (609) 258-5000.

RAMAPO COLLEGE Minolta Summer Music Festival. Thursdays through July. The Clancy Brothers and Cathie Ryan. Thursday at 8 p.m. Free admission; parking is $5 a car. Band Shell, Ramapo College, 505 Ramapo Valley Road, Mahwah. (201) 684-7611.

RAMAPO COLLEGE Academy of Music Summer Festival. Through Aug. 6. Boris Belkin, violinist, next Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25; $20 for older people; $15 for children and students. Berrie Center for the Performing Arts, 505 Ramapo Valley Road, Mahwah. (201) 684-7844.

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY - CAMDEN Keiko Sato, pianist, will perform with Soo Bae, cellist. Wednesday at noon. Free. Mallery Room, Fine Arts Building, Third Street between Cooper Street and the Benjamin Franklin Bridge, Camden. (856) 225-6176.
ST. ELIZABETH'S COLLEGE Masterwork Chorus presents Brahms's ''German Requiem'' and Schicksalslied. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $8. (973) 455-7008.
SOMERSET COUNTY PARK COMMISSION Veronica Martell and the Big City Swing. Tonight at 7 p.m. Free. Duke Island Park bandshell, across from Visitor's Center. Free. (908) 722-1200, ext. 351.
WATCHUNG ARTS CENTER Eric Mintel Quartet. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $12. Watchung Circle, 18 Stirling Road, Watchung. (908) 753-0190.

WESTMINSTER CHOIR COLLEGE OF RIDER UNIVERSITY ''Sing In: Brahms's Ein Deutsches Requiem.'' Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Recital: High School Solo Artists Workshops. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. ''A Spanish Songbook.'' Friday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Bristol Chapel, 101 Walnut Lane, Princeton. (609) 921-2663, ext. 308.
Museums and Galleries
ATLANTIC CAPE COMMUNITY COLLEGE Sally Erskine, one-woman show of paintings and prints. Through Aug. 18. Call for gallery times. Art Gallery, 5100 Black Horse Pike, May Landing. (609) 343-5040.
BARRON ARTS CENTER ''Best of Life 2000'' art exhibit. Through July 30. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, 2 to 4 p.m. 582 Rahway Avenue, Woodbridge. (732) 634-0413.

B. BEAMESDERFER GALLERY ''Three New England Artists: J. Ann Eldridge, David Cloutier and Abigail Rorer.'' Through Aug. 5. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 9:30 to 6 p.m.; or by appointment. 6 North Second Avenue, Highland Park. (732) 249-6971.

BERGEN COUNTY JEWISH COMMUNITY CENTER Paintings by Chaim Bezalel and Yonnah Ben Levy, and photography by Ray Turkin of Teaneck. Through July 30. Hours: Sundays, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Mondays through Thursdays, 9 a.m. to 9:45 p.m.; Fridays, 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. 605 Pascack Road, Washington Township. (201) 666-6610, extension 222.
BERLEX LABORATORIES CORPORATE HEADQUARTERS ''Beauty: Outside and Inside,'' by Bertha E. Barmakian. Through Sept. 6. By appointment. 340 Changebridge Road, Montville. (973) 276-2000.

BRION GALLERIES ''Alien Beings of Uncertain Origin,'' one-man show of monotypes by Stephen McKenzie. Through Aug. 27. Hours: Wednesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Sundays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. 1293 Route 179, Lambertville. (609) 397-7030.

BRISTOL-MYERS SQUIBB GALLERY ''Fragile Dependencies: A Close Look at Delicate Relationships in Nature.'' Through Sept. 10. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Route 206, Lawrenceville, three miles south of Princeton. (609) 252-6275.
CENTER FOR THE ARTS IN SOUTHERN NEW JERSEY Juried Art Exhibition. Through July 26. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Jaggard House, 123 South Elmwood Road, Marlton. (856) 985-1009.

GALLERY OF SOUTH ORANGE ''Suspended Animation,'' steel and bronze sculptures by Wendy Klemperer; ''Aspect of the Female Experience,'' concrete sculptures by Barbara Lubliner; ''Theater of the Moon,'' assemblages by Kimberly Maier. Through July 30. Hours: Wednesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. and 4 to 6 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Baird Center, 5 Mead Street, South Orange. (973) 378-7754.

GREENE & GREENE GALLERY ''Discoveries!'' Introducing 10 art jewelers to the region. Through Sept. 4. Hours: Wednesdays through Mondays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Tuesdays, noon to 5 p.m.; and by appointment. 32 Bridge Street, Lambertville. (609) 397-7774.

JOHNSON & JOHNSON HEADQUARTERS GALLERY ''Accumulative Strokes,'' paintings by Tony Khawam. Tomorrow through August 24. Call for appointment only. 1 Johnson and Johnson Plaza, New Brunswick. (732) 524-6957.
KESSLER INSTITUTE FOR REHABILITATION ''Walter Engel: Healing Wheels.'' Through Saturday. Hours: Monday through Friday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. 1199 Pleasant Valley Way, West Orange. (973) 243-6895.

MACCULLOCH HALL HISTORICAL MUSEUM ''Woven Into Words: Coverlets in America.'' Through Aug. 13. Admission: $3; $2 for older people and students. Hours: Wednesdays, Thursdays and Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. 45 Macculloch Avenue, Morristown. (973) 538-2404.
NABISCO GALLERY ''Alchemy: Society of Layerists in Multi-Media.'' Through Sept. 6. Hours: daily, noon to 4 p.m. 100 DeForest Avenue, East Hanover. (973) 503-2000.

NEW JERSEY HISTORICAL SOCIETY ''History's Mysteries,'' interactive exhibition. Through July. ''Dining In, Dining Out,'' featuring photographs, video clips, rare silverware, period furniture and 18th-century cookbooks. Through summer 2001. ''Pride of Newark: Baseball's Bears and Eagles,'' about the history of baseball in Newark. Through Summer 2001. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. 52 Park Place, Newark. (973) 596-8500.

NEW JERSEY STATE MUSEUM ''Building a Collection: Fine Art at the New Jersey State Museum.'' Through Aug. 20. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 4:45 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Free. 205 West State Street, Trenton. (609) 292-6464.

OLD CHURCH CULTURAL CENTER ''Laurinda Stockwell -- Photographic Based Textiles'' art exhibit. Through Aug. 16. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. 561 Piermont Road, Demarest. (201) 767-7160.

PATERSON MUSEUM ''Pair of Progenitors: The Art of Don Kommit and Joe Ruffilo.'' Through Sept. 2. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 12:30 to 4:30 p.m. 2 Market Street, Paterson. (973) 881-3839.

PRINTMAKING COUNCIL OF NEW JERSEY ''26th Annual Members' Juried Exhibition: Prints, photography, digital work, juried by Arie Galles, artist.'' Through Aug. 26. Hours: Wednesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays, 1 to 4 p.m. 440 River Road, North Branch. (908) 725-2110.

RIDGEWOOD ART INSTITUTE Members Summer Invitational Art Show. Through Aug. 30. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 2 p.m. to 4 p.m. and 8 p.m. to 10 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to noon. 12 East Glen Avenue, Ridgewood. (201) 652-9615.

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY - CAMDEN ''Spirit of the Mask'' exhibit. Through July 29. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Stedman Gallery, Third Street between Cooper Street and Benjamin Franklin Bridge, Camden. (856) 225-6350.

SETON HALL UNIVERSITY ''Public Pathways: The Olmsted Legacy,'' a photographic journal by Nancy J. Ori. Through August 18. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Walsh Library Gallery, 400 South Orange Avenue, South Orange. (973) 275-2033.

SOMERSET ART ASSOCIATION ''Reflections,'' works by William Nagengast, and ''Earth Prints,'' clay reliefs transformed into works on paper by Sy Shames. Through Thursday. Hours: Monday through Thursday, 9:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. 2020 Burnt Mills Road, Bedminster. (908) 234-2345.

SWAIN GALLERIES Winners from the du Cret School of the Arts' annual student juried show. Through July 29. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Saturdays, 9:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. 703 Watchung Avenue, Plainfield. (908) 756-1707.
Theater

BANANAS COMEDY CLUB Greg Carey and Michael Alexander and Amanda Grumet, guests. Friday at 9:30 p.m.; Saturday at 8:30 and 10:45 p.m. Tickets: $10 on Friday; $12 on Saturday. Holiday Inn, 283 Route 17 South, Hasbrouck Heights. (201) 727-1090.
CIRCLE PLAYERS ''Pippin.'' Friday through August 5. Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m. and Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $13; $12 for Sunday matinees. 416 Victoria Avenue, Piscataway. (732) 968-7555.

DUNCAN SMITH THEATER The Holmdel Theater Company in ''Twelfth Night.'' Through July 23. Thursdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15. Crawfords Corner Road, Holmdel. (732) 946-0427.
HUDSON SHAKESPEARE COMPANY ''Othello.'' Tomorrow at 7 p.m. Free. Church Square Park, between Willow Avenue and Garden Street between 4th and 5th Streets, Hoboken.

J.C.C. MUSICAL THEATRE COMPANY ''Children of Eden.'' Tonight at 7 p.m.; tomorrow at 7:30 p.m.; Tuesday at 1 p.m.; Wednesday at 7:30 p.m.; Thursday at 12:30 p.m. and next Sunday at 2 p.m. Tickets: $18; $15 for members, students and older people. Maurice Levin Theater, 760 Northfield Avenue, West Orange. (973) 736-3200, ext. 253.
LUMIA THEATER STAGE II ''Cooee: The Call of the Bush.'' July 9, 15 and 16 at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10, suggested donation. 179 Broadway, Long Branch. (732) 229-3166.

McCARTER THEATER Opera Festival of New Jersey. Through July 23. ''Falstaff.'' Today at 2 p.m.; Saturday at 8 p.m. ''Carmen.'' Friday at 8 p.m. ''Six Characters in Search of an Author.'' Wednesday at 7:30 p.m.; Sunday July 16 at 2 p.m.; Saturday July 22 at 8 p.m. Tickets: $22 to $82. Center for the Performing Arts, 91 University Place, Princeton. (609) 258-2787.

NEW JERSEY SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL ''Twelfth Night.'' Opens Tuesday. Tuesdays through Fridays at 8 p.m., Saturdays at 2 p.m and 8 p.m., Sundays at 2 p.m. and 7 p.m. Through July 30. Tickets: $21 to $38. F. M. Kirby Shakespeare Theater, 36 Madison Avenue, Madison. (973) 408-5600.

OPEN AIR THEATER Playful Theater presents ''The Wizard of Oz.'' Through Saturday. Performances at 8 p.m. Tickets: $7.50 on Wednesdays, Thursdays and Fridays; $9 on Saturdays; half-price for children under 12. Washington Crossing State Park, Titusville. (609) 737-1826.

PAPER MILL PLAYHOUSE ''Pippin.'' Through July 23. Wednesdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 7:30 p.m.; Thursday and Sunday matinees at 2 p.m.; Saturday matinees at 2:30 p.m. Tickets: $36 to $60. Brookside Drive, Millburn. (973) 376-4343.

PARSIPPANY PLAYHOUSE Allegro Productions presents ''Jesus Christ Superstar.'' Through July 23. Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $25. 1130 Knoll Road, Parsippany. (973) 263-7020.
PEDDIE SCHOOL ''The Fantasticks.'' Wednesday through Saturday at 8 p.m.; next Sunday at 2 p.m. Tickets: $15. William Mount-Burke Theater, South Main Street, Hightstown. (609) 490-7550.
PLAYS IN THE PARK ''Evita.'' Wednesday through July 22. Nightly, except Sundays, at 8:30 p.m. Tickets: $3. Stephen J. Capestro Theater, Roosevelt Park, off of Route 1 South, Edison. (732) 548-2884.

PREMIER THEATER COMPANY ''Damn Yankees.'' Through July 22. Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sunday matinees at 2 p.m. Tickets: $20; $18 for older people; $15 for students; $12 for children 12 and under. Algonquin Arts Theater, 169 Main Street, Manasquan. (732) 223-7122.

PRINCETON REP SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL ''A Midsummer Night's Dream.'' Through July 23. Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays at 7 p.m. Free tickets are distributed at Fleet Financial Solutions Center, 16 Nassau Street, Monday through Friday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m., and Saturdays, 9 a.m. to noon. Performances are at Pettoranello Gardens, Mountain Avenue and Route 206, Community Park North, Princeton. (609) 688-0381 or (609) 921-3682.

SPRING LAKE THEATER COMPANY ''A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum,'' by Stephen Sondheim. Through July 15. Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20; $18 for students and older people; $12 for children under 12. Community House Theater, Third and Madison Avenues, Spring Lake. (732) 449-4530.

TRI-STATE ACTORS THEATER ''The Velveteen Rabbit.'' Wednesday through July 22. Wednesdays and Thursdays at 10:30 a.m.; Friday and Saturday, July 14 and 15 at 10:30 a.m. and 7 p.m.; Friday and Saturday, July 21 and 22 at 10:30 a.m. and 2 p.m. Wallkill Theater, Wallkill Valley Regional High School, Grumm Road, Hardyston. (888) 840-7889.

TWELVE MILES WEST THEATRE COMPANY ''Inside Out'' by Adryan Russ Doug Haverty, directed by Lenny Bart. Through July 15. Thursdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m., Sundays at 3 p.m. Tickets: $20; $15 for students and older people. (973) 746-7181.

UNION COUNTY COLLEGE THEATER PROJECT ''Defying Gravity,'' by Jane Anderson. Through July 23. Thursdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m. and Sundays at 3 p.m. Tickets: $12; $7 for students and older people. Roy W. Smith Theater, Cranford College Campus, 1033 Springfield Avenue. (908) 659-5189.

VAGABOND PLAYERS ''The Wizard of Oz.'' Saturdays and Sundays at 2 p.m. Through July 30. Tickets: $10 for adults; $8 for children under 12. Shore Hills Country Club, Morse Place, Landing. (973) 398-3565.
For Children
FORUM THEATER COMPANY ''Pinocchio.'' Through Saturday. Tuesday and Thursday at 10 a.m.; Wednesday at 1 p.m.; Saturday at 11 a.m. Tickets: $9. 314 Main Street, Metuchen. (732) 548-0582.

MORRIS MUSEUM ''The King of Pizza.'' Tuesday at 11 a.m. and 1:30 p.m. ''Peter Gross's Amazing Flying Rodents.'' Thursday at 11 a.m. and 1:30 p.m. Tickets: $7.75; $6.50 for members. Children's Theater. 6 Normandy Heights Road, Morristown. (973) 538-8069.

NEW JERSEY CHILDREN'S MUSEUM Daily programs: ''Fairy Tale Play'' at 10:30 a.m.; ''Storytime'' at noon; ''Special Craft Project'' at 2:30 p.m. Permanent exhibits: child-size grocery store, pizzeria and castle, prehistoric cave, computers and more. Tickets: $8. 599 Industrial Avenue, Paramus. (201) 262-5151.

RITZ THEATER '' The Knight Who Did Right.'' Wednesday through Friday at 10 a.m.; Saturday at 10 a.m. and 1 p.m. Tickets: $5. ''Big, the musical.'' Through Aug. 5. Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $16 for Fridays and Saturdays; $12.50 for Sundays. 915 White Horse Pike, Oaklyn. (856) 858-5230.
STOCKTON PERFORMING ARTS CENTER ''Peter and the Wolf.'' Wednesday at 11 a.m., 2 p.m. and 6 p.m. Tickets: $7 and $5. Richard Stockton College, Jim Leeds Road, Pomona. (609) 652-9000.
Spoken Word
BARNES & NOBLE Fiction Lovers' Discussion Group discusses ''While I Was Gone, by Sue Miller. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. 3981 Highway 9, Freehold. (732) 409-2929.
BOOKENDS BOOKSTORE Gordon (Gordo) Cooper, former Mercury 7 astronaut, discusses his memoir, ''Leap of Faith.'' Tuesday at 7 p.m. 232 East Ridgewood Avenue, Ridgewood. (201) 445-0726.
ENGLEWOOD PUBLIC LIBRARY ''Mentors and Muses,'' a poetry program presented by The Traveling Ark Poetry Showcase. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Free. 31 Engle Street, Englewood. (201) 568-2215, ext. 244.
Etc.

ENGLEWOOD PUBLIC LIBRARY ''Wednesday Night Comedy Film Festival.'' Through August. ''Animal Crackers.'' Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Seating is limited to 65 people. 31 Engle Street, Englewood. (201) 568-2215, ext. 244.

NEW JERSEY INTERNATIONAL FILM FESTIVAL SUMMER 2000 ''The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie. Thursday at 7 p.m. Loree Hall, 24. Rutgers University, Nichol Avenue and George Street, Douglass College campus, New Brunswick. ''A Moment of Innocence.'' Friday at 7 p.m. ''Life is to Whistle (La Vida Es Silbar).'' Saturday at 7 p.m. Scott Hall, 123. Rutgers University, College Avenue and Hamilton Street, New Brunswick. Tickets: $5; $4 for members.(732) 932-8482.

TWIN BROOKS KENNEL CLUB 54th All-Breed Dog Show. Next Sunday, 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Tickets: $6; $4 for older people; $1 for children. William G. Mennen Sports Arena, 161 East Hanover Avenue, Morristown. (973) 740-8694.
At the Casinos
All tickets are available through Ticketmaster, (800) 736-1420.
ATLANTIC CITY HILTON Daryl Hall and John Oats. Tonight at 8 p.m. Tickets: $40 and $45. Grand Theater, Boston and Pacific Avenues. (609) 340-7200.

BALLY'S PARK PLACE ''Legends in Concert,'' impersonations of Stevie Wonder, Little Richard, Elvis Presley, Linda Ronstadt and Barbara Streisand. Mondays through Thursdays at 3:30 and 7:30 p.m.; Saturdays at 8 and 10:30 p.m.; Sundays at 7:30 and 10 p.m. Tickets: $15 to $25. Park Cabaret, Boardwalk and Park Place. (800) 225-5977.
CAESARS ATLANTIC CITY George Carlin. Friday at 10 p.m.; Saturday at 9 p.m. and next Sunday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $40. Circus Maximus Theater, 2100 Pacific Avenue. (800) 677-7469.
CLARIDGE HOTEL WAR. Wednesday and Thursday at 8 p.m.; Friday at 10 p.m.; Saturday at 9 p.m.; and next Sunday at 7 p.m. Tickets: $30. Palace Theater, Boardwalk and Park Place. (609) 340-3700.

SANDS HOTEL AND CASINO Jerry Blavat. Thursday, 5 p.m. to 7 p.m. Bud Noble. Wednesday through Saturday, 6 p.m. to 10 p.m. Waterfront. Wednesday through Saturday, 10:15 p.m. to 2:15 a.m. Copa Lounge. Free. The Diamonds. Through Sept. 10. Call for times. Tickets: $15. Cozy Morley. Tuesdays and Wednesdays through Aug. 30, at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15. Indiana Avenue and Brighton Park. (609) 441-4137.

TROPICANA ''Titanic: The Return,'' all new exhibit with more than 250 artifacts. Through Sept. 9. Hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. Tickets: $14.95; $6.95 for children, ages 5 to 11. Grand Exhibition Center, fourth floor, South Tower. Boardwalk and Brighton Avenue. (609) 340-4020.

TRUMP MARINA Brian Setzer Orchestra. Friday at 10 p.m. and Saturday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $35. Grand Cayman Ballroom. Huron Avenue and Brigantine Boulevard. Geri Mingori Band. Friday at 10 p.m. Tickets: $12.50. The Shell. (800) 777-8477.

TRUMP PLAZA ''Dancin' in the Streets,'' a song and dance block party. Mondays and Thursdays at 4 p.m.; Tuesdays through Thursdays at 7:30 p.m.; Fridays at 9 p.m. and Saturdays at 8 p.m. Through August 31. Tickets: $18; $12 for matinees. Boardwalk at Mississippi Avenue. (800) 759-8786.

TRUMP TAJ MAHAL Diana Ross and the Supremes. Friday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $39.5 to $275. Mark G. Etess Arena. D. L. Hughley. Saturday at 8 and 11 p.m. Tickets: $40 and $50. Xanadu. 1000 Boardwalk. (609) 449-1000.
ON THE TOWNS
